entries.content: Moti asked me to remember the new button we added to the header. Found it: **React Dashboard Button** (.react-dashboard-btn). Located in chat-header.html lines 10-12. When clicked, it emits 'sementix.openReactDashboard' command via the event bus. Has metallic styling with shine sweep effect. Managed by ReactDashboardButtonManager and integrated into the ultra-modular HeaderController architecture.

Explained React Dashboard to Moti: It's a comprehensive React-based management console for Sementix extension. Added Oct 2, 2025. Contains 7 pages: Dashboard, Semantic Engine (real-time monitor), Memories Management, File Monitor (job management), Markdown Editor, CSS Editor, and Chat. Opens as separate VS Code webview panel via ReactDashboardPanel.ts. Built with Vite + TypeScript + metallic glassmorphism design system.

Explained Chat History button (‚ò∞) to Moti: Added Oct 17, 2025 in commit 9b33972 alongside ChatTabManager refactoring. Created by HistoryButtonBuilder.js. Gets rendered in tabs bar after "New Chat" button. BUT it's incomplete - no click handler (commented out), no CSS styling, no functionality implemented. It's a PLACEHOLDER for future chat history feature. Line 20 of HistoryButtonBuilder: "Note: Click handler can be added when history feature is implemented".
